europeana:record.dc:title: Chromodoris magnifica (Quoy & Gaimard, 1832), a new nudibranch host for the shrimp Periclimenes imperator Bruce, 1967 (Pontoniinae)
Zoologische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Fransen C.H.J.M.
Goud J.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Crustacea; Decapoda; Caridea; Pontoniinae; Periclimenes imperator; Mollusca; Nudibranchia;
europeana:record.dc:description: During the NNM/Maluku Expedition 1996, in the framework of the NNM Fauna Malesiana Marine Program, a shrimp belonging to the species Periclimenes imperator Bruce, 1967, was found on a nudibranch while diving at 20 m depth in Seri Bay, on the south coast of Ambon. Periclimens imperator has been recorded throughout the tropical Indo-West Pacific, from East Africa and the Red Sea to Hawaii, from nudibranch and holothurian hosts. The nudibranch was identified as Chromodorus magnifica (Quoy & Gaimard, 1832) (see Rudman, 1982: 216-219, figs. 17A, B, 18, 19). The association with Chromodorus magnifica is recorded here for the first time.
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: Chromodoris magnifica (Quoy & Gaimard, 1832), a new nudibranch host for the shrimp Periclimenes imperator Bruce, 1967 (Pontoniinae) (URN:ISSN:00240672) (Volume 73, 12-33)
